title: Setup Python build and test infrastructure
description: Create Python build commands, update package.json or create Python build config. Create Python test script equivalent to test-agents.js.

title: Migrate and update documentation
description: Update README.md, AGENT_USAGE.md, and development guide to reflect Python implementation. Update setup instructions and dependencies.

title: Cleanup: Remove TypeScript files and dependencies
description: Remove .ts files, tsconfig.json, TypeScript dev dependencies, and npm build scripts after Python migration is complete and tested.

title: Session: TypeScript to Python Migration for YouTube Transcript Tool
description: Migrate the yt-processor from TypeScript to Python 3.13+. Remove npm/TypeScript entirely. Keep agents as markdown files calling Python scripts. Maintain mirror location for tool files (.opencode/tool/youtube-transcript.py). Use youtube-transcript-api package. Keep YOUTUBE_API_KEY env var. Feature parity maintained throughout.

title: Create Python version of youtube-transcript.ts tool
description: Migrate .opencode/tool/youtube-transcript.ts to Python. Implement using youtube-transcript-api package instead of t-youtube-transcript-fetcher. Keep all functionality: video ID validation, transcript fetching, metadata retrieval, error handling.

title: Session: Run tests and fix failing tests
Create Python version of sanitize utility
description: Migrate .opencode/utils/sanitize.ts to Python. Implement identical title sanitization logic for filenames and display.

title: Testing and validation
description: Run comprehensive tests with real YouTube API key. Verify all features work identically to TypeScript version. Test all error scenarios.

title: Setup Python project structure and configuration
description: Create pyproject.toml, requirements.txt, and setup Python environment. Set up src/ directory structure for Python code.

title: Update agents to work with Python tool
description: Modify .opencode/agent/youtube-processor.md and transcript-summarizer.md to work with Python implementation. Verify agent configurations are tool-agnostic.
